page.title: 08THE OLD VICARAGE
page.content: The old vicarage is a very big house. The kitchen has some numbers on the wall which go up to 8 and there used to be some bells. The people who owned the vicarage had a bell in each room. There were 8 rooms. The rest belonged to the servants. At the moment there are 7 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 1 lounge, 1 drawing room, 1 dining room, 1 kitchen, 5 stairs and 3 landings. They have also about 7 acres of land and in it is a wood. There used to be a fireplace in every room but some are blocked up. Most of the floors were stone or wooden planks and some were carpet. Quite a lot of the rooms had wooden shutters which locked like some wardrobe doors. Nearly all the door knobs were brass with circles getting bigger and bigger from the middle. The key to the main door was very, very big.
